what: Exploratory Data Analysis (Yet another EDA package eh)
title: Exploratory Data Analysis (Yet another EDA package eh)
Exploratory Data Analysis (Yet another EDA package eh)
text: can install development version explorebunny GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DanielBraddock/explorebunny") #> Using GitHub PAT from the git credential store. #> Skipping install of 'explorebunny' from a github remote, the SHA1 (b4d3cf21) has not changed since last install. #>   Use `force = TRUE` to force installation

title: Exploratory Data Analysis (Yet another EDA package eh)
code: library(explorebunny) iris2 <- iris iris2[iris2$Species == "setosa", "Species"] <- NA_character_ iris2 |> explore_na() #> Rows: 150

what: Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
title: Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
text: Primarily visual tool, also can tabulate , allows exploration amount missingness dataset. visual shows amount missing data column.

title: Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
code: explore_na(   df,   return = "plot",   probabilities = TRUE,   keep_all = FALSE,   colour_thresholds = c(0.1, 0.3),   zoom_in = FALSE,   reference_lines = TRUE )

title: Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
text: df dataset, class data.frame return Either "plot" "table", depending want function return probabilities want amount missing reported absolute (nrow) relative (percentage)terms keep_all Whether include columns missing anything ie n_missing = 0 colour_thresholds visuals give RAG rating missingness depending thresholds zoom_in amount missing axis max 100 percent greatest non-zero amount missing? reference_lines reference lines drawn visual show thresholds used colours

title: Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
Explore missing values in a dataset — explore_na
code: iris2 <- iris iris2[iris2$Species == "setosa", "Species"] <- NA_character_ iris2[iris2$Sepal.Length < 5.1, "Sepal.Length"] <- NA_real_ iris2[iris2$Sepal.Width > 2.8, "Sepal.Width"] <- NA_real_ iris2 |> explore_na() #> Rows: 150
